name: Kristoffer Arnsfelt Hansen
content: Kristoffer Arnsfelt Hansen Kristoffer Arnsfelt Hansen Associate Professor Department of Computer Science, Aarhus University (official personal page). PhD, Aarhus University, 2006 (genealogy). I was in 2007 at The University of Chicago for 1 year, funded by a Villum Kann Rasmussen postdoc fellowship, and in 2008-2009 at Aarhus University in a postdoc position for 2 years, funded by The Carlsberg Foundation. My main research interests are computational complexity theory (in particular Boolean circuit complexity) and algorithmic game theory. Additional interests include algorithms in general. Publications DBLP entry Google Scholar Citations Projects Complexity and Optimization in Competitive Markets. Independent Research Fund Denmark (2025-). Computational Complexity of Equilibria and Fixed Points. Independent Research Fund Denmark (2019-2023). Program Committees PC Chair: WINE 2022, SAGT 2021. PC Member: WINE 2025, SAGT 2025, EC 2025, CIAC 2025, AAMAS 2025, WINE 2024 (SPC), EC 2024, MFCS 2024, WINE 2023 (SPC), SAGT 2023, EC 2023, CIAC 2023, AAMAS 2023, AAMAS 2022, AAMAS 2021, SAGT 2018, MFCS 2014, MFCS 2013, SOFSEM 2012. Teaching Currently teaching "Optimization" and "Theory of Algorithms and Computational Complexity". Other service Body of External examiners for Computer Science (Chairman) Contact Information Kristoffer Arnsfelt Hansen Department of Computer Science Aarhus University IT-Parken, Aabogade 34 DK-8200 Aarhus N Denmark Office:Incuba 24.412 Phone:+45 2165 8246 Email:arnsfelt@remove.this.cs.au.dk
